title: The most un-userfriendly software ever
comment: This is the worst app I've ever used, not only is it poorly layed out and confusing to use it doesn't seem to have the function to input from your phone, only to download revision cards.
this app has really helped me study linux commands

title: Not user friendly
comment: The layout is not user friendly, the design is poor aesthetically, there is no in-app tutorial to begin with, you can't make your own card decks, it's very hard to find what you need, a lot of downloadable decks have obscure names and descriptions. Not only that but all of the psychology decks seem to be based on lectures in america. There is no psychology for lower levels or English psychology students.
good
Excellent

title: Good
comment: Very good application but would be nice to have preview of the images when choosing them to attach to the list

title: Very useful while studying
comment: Have been using this app for several years, mainly for the teplenishment my English vocabulary, really like it. Easy to manage your own databases and what is the most important, it helps to remember information.

title: Great for learning languages your way

title: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this APPS! THANK YOU!
comment: I just love this apps. So easy to use; I love the fact that I can download card stack from others that share them in the community and once you download it you can actually edit it your self.  So many, many thanks to those who are involved for making this an awesome study aids apps. I don't usually write ratings because I'm to lazy to do so,  that alone should tell you a lot.
Awesomest flash card app ever!!!!!!

title: Excellent
comment: Love this app! Ive used it all throughout my uni studies.  Type up my notes on my laptop in Notepad + Convert to db file using Anymemo software = flash cards anytime, anywhere on my phone. Love!

title: A ."Must Have" for learning
comment: If you spend the time to set this app up correctly with whatever lists or categories you need to memorize, there's no better tool out there.  This app has helped me immensely with my job and my hobbies,(like playing card games).

title: Simple, effective, with no ads.
comment: AnyMemo is a simple application; import, export, study, memorize--you can do whatever you want; and the free app has no ads. Perfect for memorizing/studying.

title: Free, easy to use, best flashcard app i have tried
comment: I tried a whole bunch of different flashcard apps, and none of them met my needs until this one: 1. easy to use interface. 2. allows easy importing from google drive. 3. retains formatting in spreadsheet for easy studying. 4. very responsive/fast.

title: THE ABSOLUTE BEST
comment: Beats the competition and  ankidroid which is just too complicated imo.   Smart phones and tablets - technology what's use does it have unless it improves productivity.  This little flash card program does that more than any app I've come across.  and makes my Android tab a superior tool then their Ipads.  Have donated to the developer will donate more..

title: Higly recommended

title: Good program
comment: Being a college student taking a foreign language course, I tend to use a lot of note cards and usually blow through a stack like they were nothing. This app though totally cleared that up for me, it's actually really easy to make note cards and helps to study. Very well worth the time to take a look at it if you need help studying for an exam or for simple reviewing of material

title: Excellent for a free product.  Plan to donate...

title: Good, But Needs Improvement
comment: Good: 1. This is better than Anki for Android.  It does Anki, better than Anki. Haha... 2. Imports from Google Docs and many others. 3. Creator is very responsive.  Bad: Uses  it's own Text To Speech (TTS), not the TTS engines you have on your phone.
